Citation.sTitle: Enthalpies of Solution of Glycilglycine in Water-Organic Solvent Media at 298.15 K
Citation.sAbstract: The enthalpies of solution of glycilglycine in aqueous solution of 1,4-dioxane, acetone,  formamide, N-methylformamide and N,N-dimethylformamide, with the co-solvent content up to 0.4  mole fractions, have been measured calorimetrically at T = 298.15 K. The results obtained were used to  calculate the standard enthalpies of solution ( ) and transfer ( ) of the glycilglycine from water into the  mixtures as well as the enthalpy coefficients of pair-wise interaction hxy of the solute with the organic  co-solvents in aqueous media. The hxy values were correlated with the properties of organic solvents  using the Kamlet-Taft equation. The effect of the structure properties of the mixed solvent on the  specified enthalpy characteristics of glycilclycine is discussed.
sKeyword: Mixtures of water with organic solvents.
